headline: Harden Your Systems: Today's Focus Areas

digest_items.title: Verify encryption in transit
digest_items.why: Unencrypted data transmission exposes sensitive information
digest_items.fix: Enforce HTTPS for all endpoints and use TLS for internal services

digest_items.title: Review user access permissions
digest_items.why: Stale permissions from former employees pose security risk
digest_items.fix: Conduct quarterly access reviews and remove unnecessary permissions

digest_items.title: Use security champions program
digest_items.why: Embedded security advocates improve security culture across teams
digest_items.fix: Designate security champions in each team and provide training

digest_items.title: Enable database encryption at rest
digest_items.why: Unencrypted databases are vulnerable if storage media is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) or equivalent for your database

digest_items.title: Implement API authentication
digest_items.why: Unauthenticated APIs allow unauthorized access to data and functions
digest_items.fix: Use OAuth 2.0, JWT tokens, or API keys with proper validation

digest_items.title: Verify backup encryption
digest_items.why: Unencrypted backups are a major data breach risk if storage is compromised
digest_items.fix: Enable encryption at rest and in transit for all backup solutions

digest_items.title: Use Web Application Firewall (WAF)
digest_items.why: WAF protects against common web attacks like SQL injection and XSS
digest_items.fix: Deploy CloudFlare, AWS WAF, or ModSecurity

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role
